intro: Oriastrum tarapacensis, commonly known as the Atacama morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has adapted to extreme desert conditions with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Its flowers are ephemeral, opening briefly before closing and wilting by midday. Oriastrum tarapacensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar to pollinators in a harsh environment.
